column5: Can anyone point me to a good hotel in Dryden? We usually stay at the TransCanada, but it is all booked and we need to reserve a spot for a night in August.
Holiday Inn Express... on Government Street in Dryden (807) 223-3000 Happy Fishin' Walley
The Holiday Inn is nice. Didn't mind the Comfort Inn because you can walk across the street for a beer.
Thanks for the replies guys, since we only stay a night we perfer a cheap solution. I found the link very helpful above and plan on calling a few.

We were in Dryden a couple of years ago. The manager of the restaurant serving Greek and Indian food mentioned the Town and Country as a reasonably priced motel (We stayed at the Best Western, good accomodations but more expensive than I'm used to). I'm sorry we didn't know about this motel earlier. Since we haven't stayed at the Town and Country, I cann't give you my opinion on it.http://www.townandcountrymotel.ca/index.htmlGary
We stay at the chalet. Last year it was $75 a room. Nothing fancy but nice rooms and they have restaurant right there. We sit outside and have a few beers.
